page.title: 15Darlington Conservationist
page.content: {Darlington Conservationist,} David Green was always keen on the natural world and when he grew up worked in zoos at{Whipsnade and Belle {View,Manchester.} Now home again in Darlington, he has recently been particularly interested in the{Great Crested Newt which is nearly extinct. He has been searching ponds in County Durham, came to St Teresa's school and with some of the pupils examined the pond at{Tommy Crook's {Park.} They saw{frogs, newts and some {tadpoles}in the water. Amongst the tadpoles was one of the{Great Crested {Newt.} Now{St Teresa's School}is applying for a grant from the local conservation group to develop and improve the pond. {Philip Shute.
